intro: Piriqueta mesoamericana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces long, twisting vines that can climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
